net.nanopool.contention
Interface ContentionHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultContentionHandler, ResizingContentionHandler, SleepyContentionHandler, ThrowingContentionHandler
public interface ContentionHandler

A ContentionHandler decides what to do when we reckon there's contention on the pool. Contention on the pool usually means that, last we checked, all connections was in use, so this particular can not get a connection right away. This means that we have wait a little while before we try again, and waiting is exactly what ContentionHandler implementations do. This interface is provided because the pool-using applications might want to do logging or other stuff, while they wait. The NanoPoolDataSource instances get their ContentionHandlers through their constructors when they are created.

Since:
1.0
Author:
vest

Method Summary
 void handleContention(int count, ManagedNanoPool mnp)
          Do something to ease contention on the pool.
 

Method Detail

handleContention

void handleContention(int count,
                      ManagedNanoPool mnp)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
Do something to ease contention on the pool. This usually means calling Thread.sleep(long) or Thread.yield(), but you could also throw a form of RuntimeException or SQLException if you'd rather give up on getting a connection for this particular thread - just be sure to catch it in your own code!

Parameters:
count - The number of times that this ContentionHandler has been called within the same getConnection.
mnp - The ManagedNanoPool implementation for the pool that is experiencing the contention.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
Since:
1.0
